snippet: The Obama campaign says it is focusing on smaller venues in smaller cities as it tries to connect with undecided voters.
abstract: Pres Obama consistently attracts far larger crowds than Mitt Romney at speaking events, but turnout remains far lower than it was during his 2008 campaign; Obama campaign says it is focusing on smaller venues in smaller cities as it tries to connect with undecided voters.

byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett contributed reporting from Seattle, Richard A. Oppel Jr., from Basalt, Colo., and Trip Gabriel from Des Moines.

lead_paragraph: The Obama campaign says it is focusing on smaller venues in smaller cities as it tries to connect with undecided voters.

headline.main: Obama Drawing Big Crowds, but Not Like in ’08
headline.print_headline: Obama Drawing Big Crowds, but Not Like in ’08
